planet.name: Kepler-20 e
KOI 070.04
2MASS J19104752+4220194
KIC 6850504
planet.description: The Kepler-20 system hosts at least 5 exo-planet. The Kepler team has announced the confirmation of the two smallest planets in the system, Kepler-20 e and Kepler-20 f. Kepler-20 e is most likely a rocky planet made of iron and silicates. It is smaller than Earth, approximately the size of Venus. It is not habitable because the planet is on an orbit very close to its host star and the equilibrium temperature is more than 1000 Kelvin (726C, 1340F).
